DON'T EVER APOLOGIZE FOR BEING A SALESPERSON. WE MAKE 3X MORE THAN THE AVERAGE PERSON.
Wear your Sales title proudly. Wear it like a badge. You deserve respect. You have earned it.

People do not realize how hard we have worked to make it. It's like getting to the NFL. People grow up dreaming of playing in the Super Bowl & scoring the winning touchdown. But of the millions growing up with that dream, how many have done it?
It's the same in Sales. How many people tell you when they hear you are in sales "I tried sales but it wasn't for me"? I hear it everyday.
Larry Levine once wrote an article  on what it takes to succeed. It could have been for them, but they chose not to put in the time, effort & work needed to succeed.
Sales is the hardest "easiest" job that you can find. People think we don't work. Even those who failed in sales say they can do it. Morons!
So next time you make a call to a prospect. Don't apologize for calling. You aren't wasting the prospects time. You are going to make him money. You are going to make his job easier. Why apologize?
So make that call. Stand up when calling. Be confident. Let the client feel your presence in the call. Let the client know how lucky they are you called.
And for God's sake, don't apologize!
Frustrated/excited by political ramifications on your business?
There's an incredible tool at your disposal today.

Technolutionary manages networks, Macs and mobile devices for a variety of businesses in the greater DC area. From MSP offerings, to large-scale wireless network planning and implementation, to picking the right MDM for your mobile-focused business, Technolutionary can help you get technology done right, at any scale.
We Love DC is a local-oriented weblog in Washington DC.  We write about culture, news, events, art, music and other topics.
Works as a managing editor, talent recruiter and writer for a DC-based community organization focusing on local content creation, support and viewpoint exchange.
Manages several servers, supports 150 users in 7 offices.

He is also one heck of a great guy.  You should hire him!

Tom is the key reason WeLoveDC exists; it was his baby from the start and through his creative ingenuity, perseverance and willingness to share in this endeavor, the site has blossomed into a true destination resource for many DC residents.His willingness to discuss, create and motivate the gaggle of volunteers who write for the site is tremendous and WLDC would be a pale reflection of itself if Tom was not such a driving, pivotal force in its creation and continued existence. I'm happy to be working with Tom and look forward to future successes with this great site.

Michael Wasylik
Attorney at Ricardo & Wasylik PL
February 7, 2007, Michael was a client of Tom’s

Several years ago, I made the plunge and switched to Apple.  I have no regrets, and Tom is one of the main reasons why.  On the odd day when a problem came up - usually something along the lines of "I used to do this in Windows... how do I do it on a Mac?"  - Tom would quickly point me to the easiest, simplest solution - a key combination, a piece of freeware, maybe a preferences setting.  He constantly introduced me to new and better ways of doing things on my computer.Tom's expertise extends beyond Apple to Windows networking, telephone systems, and related infrastructure.  If you've got a problem with your office set-up, the smart money says that Tom can fix it.

Vicky Tripp
Implementation Support at cr360
May 20, 2017, Tom worked with Vicky but at different companies

The worst nightmare of any consultant is to be awoken in the wee hours by an alert from your monitoring system that something has gone wrong. Calling into a support queue in the wee hours is always a slog, but not when you got someone like Vicky, whose calm demeanor and knowledgeable expertise would set you at ease AND crush the problem.Vicky was always quick to resolve our issues, work the problem through its engineering challenges, and she knew her products cold, which mean we didn't have to go back and forth to upper tiers, wasting time and effort on everyone's part. Vicky is an asset to any organization she'll be part of.

Kenneth Whittaker
IT Administrator at ChargePoint
May 20, 2017, Tom worked with Kenneth but at different companies

As a consultant, having to call into a call center is just about the most terrifying thing. You never know what you're going to find, who you'll get, and what will happen next. But getting Ken at the end of the line was like an instant victory. He knew the products cold, could walk you through menus and interfaces and logs without having to setup a screen share in a lot of cases, and was absolutely unwilling to give up on problems or people, no matter how long it takes.Ken gets my highest recommendation: hire at all costs, and were he closer to Washington DC, I'd be doing exactly that. It's rare to combine knowledge, troubleshooting skill, and a degree of customer empathy that Ken personifies. He's exactly what you want representing your organization, with pride, with esprit de corps, and with incredible competence.

summary: I have nearly 20 years experience managing Apple computers, devices and networks.  For the last dozen years, I've helped over 50 small- and medium-sized business manage their Macs effectively. As part of Technolutionary, I've helped build a business that is both service-oriented and technology-based.  We help our clients make the most of the IT resources without having to hire full-time IT specialists to perform complex operations.  In addition to managing desktops and laptops, we manage iOS deployments for schools and businesses alike, from planning to pilot programs to implementation, support and retirement of devices. We also have a great deal of experience working with enterprise wireless networks as Ruckus Networks Reseller Partner. We support more than 150 access points on large outdoor and indoor sites. My goals are to continue to expand our business, and to provide excellent service to all our existing clients.Specialties: Apple, Macintosh, MDM, macOS, wireless networks, telephony, networks, provisioning, office planning, move planning, technical writing, documentation creation, punditry, technology news, general hackery
name: Tom Bridge
title: Founding Partner, Technolutionary LLC
